question: If we assume all articles published by Nature in 2020 (articles, only, not book reviews/columns, etc) relied on statistical significance to justify their findings and they on average came to a p-value of 0.04, how many papers would be incorrect as to their claims of statistical significance? Round the value up to the next integer.

trajectory.question: If we assume all articles published by Nature in 2020 (articles, only, not book reviews/columns, etc) relied on statistical significance to justify their findings and they on average came to a p-value of 0.04, how many papers would be incorrect as to their claims of statistical significance? Round the value up to the next integer.

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to find how many research articles Nature published in 2020 to compute 4% of that number.

args.query: site:nature.com Nature 2020 articles count research articles 2020 journal=nature search

tool_executed.name: web_search
tool_executed.result:
Found 3 relevant web results:

1. 2020 Research Leaders: Leading countries/territories
   URL: https://www.nature.com/nature-index/research-leaders/2020/country/all/global
   Site: nature.com
   Summary: Each year, the Nature Index publishes tables based on counts of high-quality research outputs in the previous calendar year. Users please note:.

2. Leading research institutions in the Nature Index 2020 ...
   URL: https://www.nature.com/nature-index/news/leading-research-institutions-science-nature-index-annual-tables-twenty-twenty
   Site: nature.com
   Date: Apr 30, 2020
   Summary: The Chinese Academy of Sciences (CAS) in Beijing has topped the Nature Index 2020 Annual Tables list as the most prolific producer of research.

3. Nature Index
   URL: https://www.nature.com/nature-index/
   Site: nature.com
   Summary: Discover the world's leading research institutions, explore collaborations, compare research performance, track top papers with Nature Index.

trajectory.actor_reasoning: I need to find the number of Nature journal "Article" content items published in 2020 so I can compute 4% and round up.

tool_executed.name: web_search
tool_executed.result:
Found 3 relevant web results:

1. Articles in 2020
   URL: https://www.nature.com/nature/articles?type=article&year=2020
   Site: nature.com
   Summary: Sign up for alerts · RSS feed · nature; browse articles. Articles in 2020. Filter By: Article Type. Article (1002). All; Article (1002). Year. 2020 (1002). All ...

2. Articles in 2020
   URL: https://www.nature.com/nature/articles?year=2020
   Site: nature.com
   Summary: Our podcast highlights of 2020. The Nature Podcast team select some of their favourite stories from the past 12 months. Benjamin Thompson; Dan Fox ...

3. Review Articles in 2020
   URL: https://www.nature.com/nature/articles?type=review-article&year=2020
   Site: nature.com
   Summary: RSS feed · nature; browse articles. Review Articles in 2020. Filter By: Article Type. Review Article (19). All; Review Article (19). Year. 2020 (19). All; 2020 ...

trajectory.actor_reasoning:
From Nature’s 2020 archive, there were 1002 items of type “Article.” Taking 4% of these as potentially incorrect claims of significance gives 40.08, which rounds up to 41.

FINAL ANSWER: 41

Round the value up to the next integer.
